citeinfo.origin: Alaska Department of Fish and Game (ADF&G), Division of Commercial Fisheries, Management and Development Division
citeinfo.title: 91-01 Alaska Department of Fish and Game Division of Commercial Fisheries Annual Management Report, 1990, Bristol Bay Area. Bristol Bay Staff. April 1991

descript.abstract: Includes (but are not limited to:) (1) Alaska Board of Fisheries and Fishery Management council reports (2) Season summaries (3) White papers (4) management plans (5) annual test fish results (6) legislative reports (7) forecast (8) area management reports (9) annual shellfish surveys (10) some annual U.S./Canada; and since the 1993, the following studies have been published in this series: (11) Salmon abundance, catch and escapements studies (12) annual smolt reports (13) tagging studies and (14) special short-term or interim reports on equipment or methodologies, stock identification, management, life history, etc..
descript.purpose: This series is primarily informational, serving to: (1) promote intradepartmental exchange of information and (2) meet ad hoc reporting functions of the department to other agencies, governmental and regulatory bodies, the fishing industry and the public. Reports in this series may achieve original observations (raw data) or contain preliminary or incomplete data. These reports do not receive full editorial and peer review. Reports may be highly individualized.

idinfo.accconst: Requests for one or two pages of data and/or short reports can usually be accommodated.
idinfo.useconst: Republications of materials in this report series may be authorized by the department

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system. NOAA makes no warranty, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty.
